page.title: 12Somerleaze
page.content: The Somerleaze estate covers approximately l6 acres and the country house itself was probably built in the middle of the seventeenth century. About twelve years ago the then owner built a new house where the coach house used to be and turned the stable wing into flats. The present owners, who are named Berry, have recently changed the use of the estate by constructing a garden centre on part of it. This garden centre, which was opened in l984, sells exclusively to the horticultural trade; it does not sell bedding plants but specialises in shrubs, bushes, small trees and conifers. The Berry family embarked on this venture as they were already involved in horticulture. They do not run the garden centre themselves but employ a manager.
